conclusion: Analyze the scenario based on the given images and positions of the objects.
Object A is the multicolored cloth.
Object B is the pink cloth.
Objects C, D, E, and F are the small block-like objects initially on the table.
Objects A and B are moved through the air and placed down on the table.
The table has four small blocks (C, D, E, F) on it.
When objects A and B are placed down, they will come into contact with the table surface.
Since the table surface already has objects C, D, E, and F, these objects will be covered by the cloths A and B as they are placed down.
In Image 2, the table is clear except for the blocks C, D, E, and F.
In Image 3, the cloths A and B are placed on the table, covering some of the blocks C, D, E, and F.
In Image 3, it is evident that the cloths A and B have covered the blocks C, D, E, and F.
The blocks are no longer visible as they are under the cloths.
When objects A and B are placed down on the table, they will cover the objects C, D, E, and F, making them invisible under the cloths.
The blocks C, D, E, and F will be hidden under the cloths A and B.
